docs.text: Welcome to Trainviz Trainviz is a python package for easily visualizing live AI training data in the browser. Commands trainviz - Launch a trainviz server. Go to Installation Go to API Documentation Go to Contributing Go to License
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Trainviz is a python package for easily visualizing live AI training data in the browser.
docs.title: Welcome to Trainviz

docs.text: trainviz - Launch a trainviz server. Go to Installation Go to API Documentation Go to Contributing Go to License
docs.title: Commands

docs.text: API Reference Trainlytics provides a simple API to track and visualize training metrics in real-time. trainviz.start() trainviz.start() Launches the Trainviz server in a background thread. Multiple calls have no effect if the server is already running. trainviz.update_value(key, value, sample_rate=1, sliding_window=None) trainviz.update_value(key, value, sample_rate=1, sliding_window=None) Updates a tracked metric and pushes it to the live dashboard. Parameters: key : str — Name of the metric (e.g., "loss", "accuracy") value : float — New value to record sample_rate : int — Aggregate every N values before storing sliding_window : int — Keep only the last N values to limit memory
docs.title: API Reference

docs.text: Trainlytics provides a simple API to track and visualize training metrics in real-time.
docs.title: API Reference

docs.text: trainviz.start() Launches the Trainviz server in a background thread. Multiple calls have no effect if the server is already running.
docs.title: trainviz.start()

docs.text: trainviz.update_value(key, value, sample_rate=1, sliding_window=None) Updates a tracked metric and pushes it to the live dashboard. Parameters: key : str — Name of the metric (e.g., "loss", "accuracy") value : float — New value to record sample_rate : int — Aggregate every N values before storing sliding_window : int — Keep only the last N values to limit memory
docs.title: trainviz.update_value(key, value, sample_rate=1, sliding_window=None)

docs.text: Installation This page explains how to install Trainlytics , either for testing, development, or production use. Prerequisites Python 3.9 or higher pip package manager Optional: virtual environment recommended for isolation Install from PyPI (Official Release) Once Trainlytics is released on PyPI, you can install it directly: pip install trainviz
docs.title: Installation
